isis.stitle: RADIATOR SHUTTERS - OPERATION - AIR SHUTTER CONTROLS

svcproc.title: AIR SHUTTER CONTROLS
svcproc.para: The normally closed thermal sensing switch is mounted in the engine water jacket. It opens in response to low coolant temperature, sending air pressure through to actuate the air solenoid. The air cylinder rod then closes the shutter vanes, and keeps them closed until the engine operating temperature rises to the maximum level.
This closes the shutter thermal sensing switch, and the air cylinder exhausts air through the shutter thermostat. This allows the shutter springs to open the vanes.
